metadata.Title: CVE-2021-34552 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Pillow through 8.2.0 and PIL (aka Python Imaging Library) through 1.1.7 allow an attacker to pass controlled parameters directly into a convert function to trigger a buffer overflow in Convert.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-34552` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-imaging - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1.6+esm1
python-pil - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1.6+esm1
python-pil.imagetk - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1.6+esm1
python3-pil - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1.6+esm1
python3-pil.imagetk - 3.1.2-0ubuntu1.6+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: mdeslaur> limited to a DoS only because of FORTIFY_SOURCE

criterions.comment: pillow package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.1.2-0ubuntu1.6+esm1').
